As an AI language model, I cannot provide medical advice, but here are some general tips that may help prevent negative effects when using VR:

1. Take breaks: It's important to take frequent breaks when using virtual reality to prevent motion sickness and cognitive overload.

2. Limit your use: Avoid using virtual reality for extended periods and limit your time in VR environments to minimize the risk of addiction, social isolation, and decreased physical activity.

3. Adjust your headset: Make sure your VR headset is properly adjusted to reduce eye strain and physical discomfort.

4. Stay hydrated: Drinking plenty of water and staying hydrated can help prevent motion sickness and other physical discomforts.

5. Use safe equipment: Make sure your VR equipment is safe and radiation-free.

6. Consult with your doctor: If you have a history of motion sickness, eye fatigue, or any other medical conditions, or if you experience negative effects after using virtual reality, it may be a good idea to speak with your doctor or health care professional.
